custom_2641 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.em:
With the fundamental belief that every student can learn, the primary purpose of Garnett Unified School District No. 365 is to
provide each student the learning opportunity for him/her to establish a foundation for success, both now and in the future.

div.class: custom_145939 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
div.p: Notice: Attendance at Board of Education meetings will be limited to not more than 10 as ordered by the governor of the state of Kansas due to COVID-19. To make the meeting open to the public, this meeting will be available through Zoom using a link that will be provided below, for additional information please contact the district office at 785-448-6155. Agenda information can be found using the Administration Tab and selecting Board of Education, then Board Agenda.

div.class: custom_149426 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
div.p: USD 365 Students please take a moment to complete a continuous learning survey by clicking the following link.

p.strong: Help your child get ready to read in minutes a day

div.p: Introducing babble. talk. read. (BTR), an initiative bringing caregivers bite-sized, research-backed tips on how to help their children get ready to read. Follow along on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for regular updates, and download our app for Android and iOS to receive notifications about learning opportunities in YOUR school district. Follow on Social Media @BTRProgram Download the Free App Search “Babble Talk Read”

div.class: custom_16276 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.strong: USD 365 - A small community with a big passion for your child's education!

div.class: embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9
div.video: Your browser does not support the video tag.

div.center: A small community with a big passion for your child's education. Unified School District 365 is located in Anderson County, Kansas just 45 minutes from Kansas City, Lawrence, Emporia and Topeka.

div.class: custom_11932 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

hr.p:
The U.S.D. #365, Garnett, Kansas, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex,
disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other
designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries or complaints
regarding the non-discrimination policies including requests for accommodations or access to a District
facility to participate in a program, activity, or service:

Donald Blome, Superintendent
Garnett USD #365
PO Box 328
Garnett, KS 66032
785 448-6155
785 448-6157(Fax)

For further information about anti-discrimination laws and regulations, or to file a complaint of
discrimination with the Office for Civil Rights in the U.S. Department of Education (OCR), please contact
OCR at (816) 268-0550 (voice), or (877) 521-2172 (telecommunications device for the deaf), or
ocr.kansascity@ed.gov. Click here for more information.
